Package data.automaton.implementations

Class AutomatonFactory

java.lang.Object
data.automaton.implementations.AutomatonFactory
public class AutomatonFactory extends Object
A factory for automaton specific objects.

  • Method Details

    • createDFA

      public static DFA createDFA(Set<State> states, Alphabet alphabet, TransitionFunction transitionFunction, State startState, Set<State> acceptingStates)
      Creates a DFA.
      Parameters:
      states - state set
      alphabet - alphabet
      transitionFunction - the transition function. has to be defined with states in the state set and symbols in the alphabet.
      startState - the start state. Has to be element of states
      acceptingStates - the set of accepting states. Has to be a subset of states
      Returns:
      a new DFA

    • createDFA

      public static DFA createDFA(DFA dfa)
      Creates a DFA as a copy of a given dfa.
      Parameters:
      dfa - the dfa to copy
      Returns:
      a new DFA

    • createKleeneStartDFA

      public static DFA createKleeneStartDFA(Alphabet alphabet)
      Creates a DFA that decides A* for alphabet A. The start_state will get an arbitrary name.
      Parameters:
      alphabet - alphabet A
      Returns:
      a new DFA that decides A*

    • createKleeneStartDFA

      public static DFA createKleeneStartDFA(Alphabet alphabet, State startState)
      Creates a DFA that decides A* for alphabet A.
      Parameters:
      alphabet - alphabet
      startState - the start state. The only state of the dfa.
      Returns:
      a new DFA that decides the empty set

    • createEmptySetDFA

      public static DFA createEmptySetDFA(Alphabet alphabet)
      Creates a DFA that decides the empty set over alphabet A. The start_state will get an arbitrary name.
      Parameters:
      alphabet - alphabet
      Returns:
      a new DFA that decides the empty set

    • createEmptySetDFA

      public static DFA createEmptySetDFA(Alphabet alphabet, State startState)

      Parameters:
      alphabet - alphabet
      startState - the start state. The only state of the dfa.
      Returns:
      a new DFA that decides the empty set

    • createAlphabet

      public static Alphabet createAlphabet(Alphabet alphabet)
      Creates a copy of an alphabet
      Parameters:
      alphabet - the alphabet to copy
      Returns:
      a new alphabet identical to the input alphabet
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the input alphabet is null

      Creates a new State
      Parameters:

      Returns:
